description: Module provides an introductory training in advanced intervention strategies utilised in clinical psychology practice. Students will become familiar with current developments in evidence-based cognitive-behavioural therapies, with particular focus on complex, severe, and enduring presentations of mental ill-health, such as psychosis, bipolar affective disorder, selected personality disorders, and complex PTSD. A repertoire of empirically grounded specialist treatment models will be introduced, including CBT for psychosis (CBTp), Metacognitive Therapy (MCT), and Narrative Exposure Therapy (NET). Elements of Behavioural Family Therapy (BFT) and Family Intervention for psychosis (FIp) will also be presented. Positive and strengths-based approaches in psychological therapies will be discussed.
title: Advanced Psychological Practice
prerequisite:
PLC5011A (Clinical Placement 1)
PLC5002 (Adult Psychopathology)
PLC5004 (Psychological Intervention and Therapy)
